item.title: A small point about Fixed Point...
item.description: Fixed-point ? The fixed-point of a function \(f(x)\) is a value \(x\) such that the equation \(f(x) = x\) is true. For example, \(0\) is a fixed-point of the familiar trigonometric function \(sin\), since \(sin(0)=0\). Starting with this simple definition, I was shown some amazing piece of programming by Prof. Gerald Jay Sussman in the legendary SICP course (lecture-2A to be specific). Inspired by the lecture, I quickly scribbled the following piece of code verbatim in my Scheme environment.
